title: Measures in the Public Interest Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)), of the Social Welfare
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 3) (Emergency Measures in 
the Public Interest-Jobseeker’s Benefit) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020. 

Commencement

title: Measures in the Public Interest Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)), of the Social Welfare

text_raw:
2. These Regulations come into operation on 19 March 2020. 

Emergency measures in the public interest - jobseeker’s benefit.

title: Measures in the Public Interest Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)), of the Social Welfare
heading: 3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control)
text_raw:
3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 
Regulations 2007 are amended by the insertion of the following article after 
article 52: 

“Emergency measures in the public interest - jobseeker’s benefit. 

52A. 

(1) Subject to sub-article (2), section 62(4) shall not apply from 19 

March 2020 until the date specified in sub-article (2). 

(2) This article shall cease to have effect on 9 May 2020.” 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 3rd April, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [95] 3 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the foregoing 
Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 March, 2020. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

30 March, 2020. 

REGINA DOHERTY, 

Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [95]

title: Measures in the Public Interest Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)), of the Social Welfare
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations temporarily suspend the rule in section 62(4) of the Social 
Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 which provides that Jobseeker’s Benefit is paid 
only from the fourth day of unemployment. The measure is being introduced to 
mitigate the impact on employers and employees arising from COVID-19 and 
will apply from the 19th of March 2020 until the 8th of May 2020 inclusive. For 
that period, Jobseeker’s Benefit will be paid from the first day of unemployment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [95] 5
